name: clipseq-binding
title: CLIP-seq RNA-Protein Interaction Analysis (nf-core/clipseq)
description: Analyze CLIP-seq (Crosslinking and Immunoprecipitation sequencing) data to identify RNA-protein binding sites. Maps where RNA-binding proteins interact with RNA molecules, revealing post-transcriptional gene regulation mechanisms. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,replicate`
content:
CLIP-seq RNA-Protein Interaction Analysis

The nf-core/clipseq pipeline analyzes CLIP-seq data to identify where RNA-binding proteins (RBPs) interact with RNA molecules, revealing mechanisms of post-transcriptional gene regulation.

Scientific Applications

  • RNA Regulation: Identify RBP binding sites on mRNAs
  • Splicing Control: Study splicing factor binding
  • mRNA Stability: Investigate decay and stability mechanisms
  • Translation Control: Map ribosome and translation factor binding
  • Disease Mechanisms: Study RBP dysfunction in disease
  • Drug Targets: Identify RBPs for therapeutic targeting

Pipeline Features

  • UMI Deduplication: Remove PCR duplicates
  • Crosslink Identification: Precise binding site mapping
  • Peak Calling: Multiple methods (iCount, PureCLIP, Piranha)
  • Motif Discovery: Identify RNA binding motifs
  • Quality Control: Comprehensive QC metrics

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with CLIP-seq FASTQ files:

  • sample: Sample identifier
  • fastq_1: Single-end FASTQ file

Key Outputs

  • Binding Sites: Crosslink coordinates
  • Peak Calls: Enriched binding regions
  • Motifs: RNA sequence motifs bound by protein
  • QC Reports: Read statistics and quality metrics

Perfect for: RNA biologists • Post-transcriptional regulation researchers • Splicing researchers • Translation biologists
